EINSTEIN PERSONALIZATION
Data Graph and Insight Settings for Using the Maximize Revenue Recommendation

Use the instructions in this section to supplement your Data Cloud data graph and calculated insight setup configuration for Einstein Personalization to use the Maximize Revenue goal-based recommender. To use the Maximize Revenue goal-based recommender, you must add certain objects and fields that the recommender uses during training.

Example: Profile Data Graph Settings For Using the Maximize Revenue Recommendation
When configuring a profile data graph for a retail environment, and when planning to use the Maximize Revenue recommender, you must include certain objects and fields in the profile data graph.
Example: Item Data Graph Settings for Using the Maximize Revenue Recommendation
Einstein Personalization uses the item data graph to reference content (products, articles, blogs, and so on) to recommend, and attributes associated with each item for use in filtering. When configuring an item data graph for a retail environment, and when planning to use the Maximize Revenue recommender, you must include certain related objects and fields. The maximize revenue recommender uses the Product Sales calculated insight. We recommend configuring this insight before creating the item data graph.
Example: Configure a Calculated Insight for Using the Maximize Revenue Recommendation
To use the maximize revenue goal-based recommender, you must ensure that a calculated insight that you add to your item data graph contains specific SQL code. This SQL code calculates the sum of products sold. The Einstein Personalization app uses the output from the insight to create a list of top-selling products.
